article.paragraph: Amitabh Harivansh Bachchan(IPA-hiəmɪˈtaːbʱ ˈbəttʃənIPA; born 11 October 1942) is an Indian film actor. He first gained popularity in the early 1970s for movies likeDeewaar (1975 film)DeewarandZanjeer (1973 film)Zanjeer, and was dubbed India's first "angry young man" for his on-screen roles inBollywood. He has since appeared in over 180 Indian films in a career spanning more than four decades.cite webhttp://guru.bafta.org/amitabh-bachchan-interview-videoAmitabh Bachchan: A Life in PicturesBafta.org23 March 2012yeshttps://web.archive.org/20111228221416/http://guru.bafta.org:80/amitabh-bachchan-interview-video28 December 2011cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/1945451.stmFilm legend promotes BollywoodBBC News23 April 200215 January 2010Bachchan is widely regarded as one of the greatest and most influential actors in the history ofIndian cinema.cite newsWajihuddinMohammedEgypt's Amitabh Bachchan maniahttp://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2005-12-02/india/27839664_1_bachchan-fan-mania-indians22 November 2011[[The Times of India]]2 December 2005cite newsJatrasToddIndia's Celebrity Film Starshttp://www.forbes.com/2001/03/09/0309bollywood.htmlArticle[[Forbes]]22 November 20119 March 2001cite webBachchan Receives Lifetime Achievement Award at DIFFhttp://www.khaleejtimes.com/displayarticle.asp?xfileKhaleej Times24 November 201125 November 2009So total was his dominance of the movie scene in the 1970s and 1980s that the French directorFranois Truffautcalled him a "one-man industry."cite webChina DailyTruffaut labeled Bachchan a one-man industryhttp://app1.chinadaily.com.cn/star/history/00-07-07/l03-film.html1 February 2008http://web.archive.org/web/20080201030338/http://app1.chinadaily.com.cn/star/history/00-07-07/l03-film.html1 February 2008nocite newshttp://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-10-10/news-interviews/43032903_1_amitabh-bachchan-saat-hindustani-inquilab/Amitabh Bachchan: Indira Gandhi helped him get into filmstimesofindia.com10 October 201323 October 2013https://web.archive.org/web/20131113015740/http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-10-10/news-interviews/43032903_1_amitabh-bachchan-saat-hindustani-inquilabNov 3, 2013

Bachchan has won manyList of awards and nominations received by Amitabh Bachchanmajor awardsin his career, including threeNational Film Awards (India)National Film AwardsasNational Film Award for Best ActorBest Actor, a number of awards at international film festivals and award ceremonies and fourteenFilmfare Awards. He is the most-nominated performer in any major acting category at Filmfare, with 39 nominations overall. In addition to acting, Bachchan has worked as aplayback singer, film producer and television presenter. He also had a stint in politics in the 1980s.

TheGovernment of Indiahonoured him with thePadma Shriin 1984, thePadma Bhushanin 2001 and thePadma Vibhushanin 2015 for his contributions tothe arts.cite webhttp://mha.nic.in/sites/upload_files/mha/files/LST-PDAWD-2013.pdfPadma AwardsMinistry of Home Affairs, Government of India2015July 21, 2015TheGovernment of Francehonoured him with its highest civilian honour, Knight of theLgion d'honneurLegion of Honour, in 2007 for his exceptional career in the world of cinema and beyond.cite newsnews.bbc.co.ukAmitabh awarded the Legion of Honourhttp://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/6306201.stm11 March 200727 January 2007GeetaPandey
Bachchan made his Hollywood debut in 2013 withThe Great Gatsby (2013 film)The Great Gatsby, in which he played a non-Indian Jewish character, Meyer Wolfsheim.
article.heading: Early and personal life
article.paragraph: see alsoBachchan familyBachchan was born inAllahabad, Uttar Pradesh, in north central India.cite newsMasihArchana9 October 2012Take a tour of Amitabh's home in Allahabadhttp://www.rediff.com/movies/slide-show/slide-show-1-take-a-tour-of-amitabhs-home-in-allahabad/20121009.htm[[rediff.com]]14 February 2014His fatherHarivansh Rai Bachchanwas aHindipoet and his motherTeji Bachchanwas aPunjabi peoplePunjabiSikhfrom Lyallpur (nowFaisalabad),Punjab Province (British India)Punjab.cite bookBollywood cinema: temples of desireMishra, VijayRoutledge2001978-0-415-93015-4131Bachchan was initially namedInquilaab,inspired by the phraseInquilab Zindabadpopularly used during the Indian independence struggle. In English,Inquilab Zindabadmeans "Long live the revolution." However, at the suggestion of fellow poetSumitranandan Pant, Harivansh Rai changed the boy's name to Amitabh, which means "the light that will never die."citation neededNovember 2014Although his surname wasShrivastava, Amitabh's father had adopted the pen name Bachchan ("child-like" in colloquial Hindi), under which he published all of his works.citation neededNovember 2014It is with this last name that Amitabh debuted in films and for all other practical purposes, Bachchan has become the surname for all of his immediate family.citation neededNovember 2014Bachchan's father died in 2003, and his mother in 2007.cite webTeji Bachchan passes awayhttp://www.hindustantimes.com/StoryPage/StoryPage.aspx?id[[Hindustan Times]]Khan, Alifiya10 February 2011

Bachchan is an alumnus ofSherwood College,Nainital. He later attendedKirori Mal College,Delhi University.cite newsAmitabh Bachchan's journey to the tophttp://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/Amitabh+Bachchan%27s+journey+to+the+top/1/65773.html[[India Today]]October 10, 2009He has a younger brother, Ajitabh. His mother had a keen interest in theatre and was offered a feature film role, but she preferred her domestic duties. Teji had some influence in Amitabh Bachchan's choice of career because she always insisted that he should "take the centre stage."cite webReviews on: To Be or Not To Be Amitabh Bachchan – Khalid Mohamedhttp://www.mouthshut.com/review/To-Be-or-Not-To-Be-Amitabh-Bachchan-Khalid-Mohamed-review-osmuomqns
Bachchan is married to actressJaya Bhaduri. The couple have two children, Shweta Nanda (wife of businessmanNikhil Nanda) andAbhishek Bachchan(actor and husband of actressAishwarya Rai).
article.heading: Career
Early work: 19691972
article.paragraph: Bachchan made his film debut in 1969 as a voice narrator inMrinal Sen'sNational Film Award for Best Feature FilmNational Awardwinning filmBhuvan Shome.cite newsSuresh Kohlihttp://www.thehindu.com/arts/cinema/article3428922.eceArts / Cinema: Bhuvan Shome (1969)The Hindu17 May 201211 December 2012Chennai, IndiaHis first acting role was as one of the seven protagonists in the filmSaat Hindustanidirected byKhwaja Ahmad Abbasand featuringUtpal Dutt,Anwar Ali (actor)Anwar Ali(brother of comedianMehmood AliMehmood),Madhu (actor)MadhuandJalal Agha.cite newsAvijit Ghosh, TNN 7 November 2009, 01.14pm ISThttp://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2009-11-07/india/28085479_1_amitabh-bachchan-saat-hindustani-malayalam-actorBig B's debut film hit the screens 40 yrs ago, todayThe Times of India11 December 20127 November 2009cite webhttp://in.rediff.com/movies/2007/aug/09amitabh.htm'I felt I did a good job in Black'Rediff.com9 August 200724 March 2012

Anand (1971 film)Anand(1971) followed, in which Bachchan starred alongside Rajesh Khanna. His role as a doctor with a cynical view of life garnered Bachchan his firstFilmfare AwardsFilmfareBest Supporting Actoraward. He then played his first antagonist role as an infatuated lover-turned-murderer inParwana (1971 film)Parwaana(1971). Following Parwaana were several films includingReshma Aur Shera(1971). During this time, he made a guest appearance in the filmGuddi (1971 film)Guddiwhich starred his future wife Jaya Bhaduri. He narrated part of the filmBawarchi.In 1972 he made an appearance in the road action comedyBombay to Goadirected byS. Ramanathan. Many of Bachchan's films during this early period did not do well, but that was about to change.cite web80 iconic performances 1/10http://www.filmfare.com/details.php?id1 June 201029 November 2011yeshttp://web.archive.org/web/20120118035457/http://www.filmfare.com/details.php?id18 January 2012
article.heading: Rise to stardom: 19731983
article.paragraph: File:BigB N JayaB.jpgrightthumb225pxBachchan and wifeJaya Bhaduriin 2013, the couple got married in 1973, after the release of ''Zanjeer (1973 film)Zanjeer''.DirectorPrakash Mehracast him in the leading role for the filmZanjeer (1973 film)Zanjeer(1973) as Inspector Vijay Khanna. The film was a sharp contrast to the romantically themed films that had generally preceded it and established Amitabh in a new personathe "angry young man" ofBollywoodcinema.Filmfare considers this one of the most iconic performances of Bollywood history.The film was a huge success and one of the highest grossing films of that year, breaking Bachchan's dry spell at the box office and making him a star.cite webhttp://www.boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCatBox Office 1973Boxofficeindia.com12 November 2013yeshttps://web.archive.org/20131020131818/http://boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCat20 October 2013From then onwards, Bachchan became one of the most successful leading men of the film industry. He earned his first Filmfare nomination for Best Actor forZanjeer. The year 1973 was also when he married Jaya, and around this time they appeared in several films together; not only inZanjeerbut in films such asAbhimaan (1973 film)Abhimaanwhich followed and was released only a month after their marriage and was also successful at the box office. Later, Bachchan played the role of Vikram, once again along with Rajesh Khanna, in the filmNamak Haraam, a social drama directed byHrishikesh Mukherjeeand scripted by Biresh Chatterjee addressing themes of friendship. His supporting role won him his secondFilmfare AwardsFilmfareBest Supporting Actoraward.

In 1974, Bachchan made several guest appearances in films such asKunwara Baap (1974 film)Kunwara BaapandDost (1974 film)Dost, before playing a supporting role inRoti Kapda Aur Makaan. The film, directed and written byManoj Kumar, addressed themes of honesty in the face of oppression and financial and emotional hardship and was the top earning film of 1974. Bachchan then played the leading role in filmMajboor (1974 film)Majboor, released on 6 December 1974, which was a remake of the Hollywood filmZig Zag (1970 film)Zig Zag. The film was a success at the box office.Box Office India.waybackhttp://boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCat20131020121213In 1975, he starred in a variety of film genres from the comedyChupke Chupke,the crime dramaFaraarto the romantic dramaMili (1975 film)Mili.1975 was also the year when Bachchan appeared in two films regarded as important in Hindi cinema history. He starred in theYash Chopradirected filmDeewaar (1975 film)Deewaaralong withShashi Kapoor,Nirupa Roy, andNeetu Singh, earning him aFilmfare AwardsFilmfarenomination for Best Actor. The film became a major hit at the box office in 1975, ranking in at number 4.cite webhttp://www.boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCatBox Office 1975BoxOffice India.comyeshttps://web.archive.org/20131020122136/http://boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCat20 October 2013Indiatimes MoviesranksDeewaaramongst theTop 25 Must See Bollywood Films.Released on 15 August 1975 wasSholay, which became the highest grossing film of 1975 and also of all time in India, earningIndian rupeeINRformatnum:2364500000equivalent to US$60 million, after adjusting for inflation.cite webSholayhttp://www.ibosnetwork.com/asp/filmbodetails.asp?idInternational Business Overview Standard6 December 2007in which Bachchan played the role of Jaidev. In 1999,BBCIndia declared it the "Film of the Millennium" and likeDeewar, has been cited byIndiatimesmoviesas amongst theTop 25 Must See Bollywood Films.cite newsKanwar, Rachna25 Must See Bollywood Movies3 October 2005http://movies.indiatimes.com/Special_Features/25_Must_See_Bollywood_Movies/articleshow/msid-1250837,curpg-10.cmshttp://web.archive.org/web/20090220161340/http://movies.indiatimes.com/Special_Features/25_Must_See_Bollywood_Movies/articleshow/msid-1250837,curpg-10.cms20 February 2009Indiatimes movies6 December 2007In that same year, the judges of the 50th annualFilmfare Awardsawarded it with the special distinction award calledFilmfare Best Film of 50 Years.

In 1976 he was cast by Yash Chopra in the romantic family dramaKabhie Kabhie (1976 film)Kabhie Kabhie. Bachchan starred as a young poet named Amit Malhotra who falls deeply in love with a beautiful young girl named Pooja (Raakhee) who ends up marrying someone else (Shashi Kapoor). The film was notable for portraying Bachchan as a romantic hero, a far cry from his "angry young man" roles likeZanjeerandDeewar. The film evoked a favourable response from critics and audiences alike. Bachchan was again nominated for the Filmfare Best Actor Award for his role in the film. That same year he played a double role inAdalat (1976 film)Adalatas father and son. In 1977, he won his firstFilmfare Best Actor Awardfor his performance inAmar Akbar Anthonywhere he played the third lead oppositeVinod KhannaandRishi Kapooras Anthony Gonsalves. The film was the highest grossing film of that year. His other successes that year includeParvarish (1977 film)ParvarishandKhoon Pasina.cite webhttp://www.boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCatBox Office 1977Boxofficeindia.com11 December 2012yeshttps://web.archive.org/20121012163829/http://boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCat12 October 2012He once again resumed double roles in films such asKasme Vaade(1978) as Amit and Shankar andDon (1978 film)Don(1978) playing the characters of Don, a leader of an underworld gang and his look alike Vijay. His performance won him his secondFilmfare Best Actor Award. He also gave towering performances in Yash Chopra'sTrishul (film)Trishuland Prakash Mehra'sMuqaddar Ka Sikandarboth of which earned him further Filmfare Best Actor nominations.

In 1979, Bachchan starred inSuhaag (1979 film)Suhaagwhich was the highest earning film of that year. In the same year he also enjoyed critical acclaim and commercial success with films likeMr. Natwarlal,Kaala Patthar (1979 film)Kaala PattharandThe Great Gambler. Amitabh was required to use his singing voice for the first time in a song from the filmMr. Natwarlalin which he starred withRekha. Bachchan's performance in the film saw him nominated for both the Filmfare Best Actor Award and theFilmfare Award for Best Male Playback Singer. He also received Best Actor nomination forKaala Pattharand then went on to be nominated again in 1980 for theRaj Khosladirected filmDostana (1980 film)Dostana, in which he starred oppositeShatrughan SinhaandZeenat Aman.Dostanaproved to be the top grossing film of 1980.cite webhttp://boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCatBoxOffice India.comBoxOffice India.com15 January 2010http://web.archive.org/web/20100102005754/http://boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCat2 January 2010noIn 1981, he starred in Yash Chopra's melodrama filmSilsila (film)Silsila, where he starred alongside his wife Jaya andRekha. Other films of this period likeShaan (film)Shaan(1980),Shakti (1982 film)Shakti(1982) which pitted him against the veteran actorDilip Kumarwere not successful at the box office butRam Balram(1980),Naseeb (1981 film)Naseeb(1981) andLawaaris(1981) were successful.cite webBox Office IndiaBachchan's box office successhttp://boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCat27 January 2015yeshttps://web.archive.org/20131005055546/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCat5 October 2013

In 1982 he played double roles in the filmsSatte Pe SattaandDesh Premeewhich succeeded at the box office.cite webhttp://boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCathttps://web.archive.org/web/20130928072451/http://boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCatBoxofficeindia.com28 September 2013boxofficeindia.comIn 1983 he played a triple role inMahaanand starred in the top grossing film of that yearCoolie.cite webhttp://boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCathttps://web.archive.org/web/20130928072533/http://boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCatBoxofficeindia.com28 September 2013boxofficeindia.com
article.heading: 1982 injury while filmingCoolie
article.paragraph: On 26 July 1982, while filmingCoolie (1983 Hindi film)Cooliein the University Campus in Bangalore, Bachchan suffered a near fatal intestinal injury during the filming of a fight scene with co-actorPuneet Issar.cite webRediff.comBachchan injured whilst shooting scenehttp://www.rediff.com/entertai/2001/oct/11amit.htm11 March 2007http://web.archive.org/web/20070304103635/http://www.rediff.com/entertai/2001/oct/11amit.htm4 March 2007noBachchan was performing his own stunts in the film and one scene required him to fall onto a table and then on the ground. However, as he jumped towards the table, the corner of the table struck his abdomen, resulting in asplenic rupturefrom which he lost a significant amount of blood. He required an emergencysplenectomyand remained critically ill in hospital for many months, at times close to death. The public response included prayers in temples and offers to sacrifice limbs to save him, while later, there were long queues of well-wishing fans outside the hospital where he was recuperating.cite webhttp://www.hindustantimes.com/News-Feed/Entertainment/Amitabh-Bachchan-no-longer-excited-about-birthdays/Article1-463669.aspxAmitabh Bachchan no longer excited about birthdaysHindustan Times10 October 200911 December 2012

Nevertheless, he resumed filming later that year after a long period of recuperation. The film was released in 1983, and partly due to the huge publicity of Bachchan's accident, the film was a box office success and the top grossing film that year.cite webBox Office IndiaCoolie a successhttp://www.boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCat11 March 2007yeshttp://web.archive.org/web/20120112040659/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCat12 January 2012

The director,Manmohan Desai, altered the ending ofCoolieafter Bachchan's accident. Bachchan's character was originally intended to have been killed off but after the change of script, the character lived in the end. It would have been inappropriate, said Desai, for the man who had just fended off death in real life to be killed on screen. Also, in the released film the footage of the fight scene is frozen at the critical moment, and a caption appears onscreen marking this as the instant of the actor's injury and the ensuing publicity of the accident.cite webhttp://movies.ndtv.com/movie_story.aspx?Section30 years after the Coolie accident: Big B's "second birthday"Movies.ndtv.com2 August 201211 December 2012

Later, he was diagnosed withMyasthenia gravis. His illness made him feel weak both mentally and physically and he decided to quit films and venture into politics. At this time he became pessimistic, expressing concern with how a new film would be received and stated before every release, "Yeh film to flop hogi!" ("This film will flop").cite webmouthshut.comReviews on: To Be or Not To Be Amitabh BachchanMohamed, Khalidhttp://www.mouthshut.com/review/To_Be_or_Not_To_Be_Amitabh_Bachchan_-_Khalid_Mohamed-72513-1.html11 March 2007
article.heading: Politics: 198487
article.paragraph: In 1984, Bachchan took a break from acting and briefly entered politics in support of long-time family friend,Rajiv Gandhi. He contested Allahabad's seat of8th Lok SabhaagainstH. N. Bahuguna, formerChief Minister of Uttar Pradeshand won by one of the highest victory margins inGeneral elections in Indiageneral election history(68.2% of the vote).cite webhttp://www.hindustantimes.com/news/specials/amitabh/politics.htmAmitabh Bachchan: Stint in PoliticsHindustan Times5 December 2005http://web.archive.org/web/20060109123607/http://www.hindustantimes.com/news/specials/amitabh/politics.htm9 January 2006noHis political career, however, was short-lived: he resigned after three years, calling politics acesspool. The resignation followed the implication of Bachchan and his brother in the "Bofors scandal" by a newspaper, which he vowed to take to court. Bachchan was eventually found not guilty of involvement in the ordeal.cite webhttp://www.sathnam.com/Features/17/interview-with-amitabh-bachchanInterview with Amitabh Bachchansathnam.comhttp://www.webcitation.org/5ppKBfYB718 May 2010no

His old friend,Amar Singh (politician)Amar Singh, helped him during a financial crisis due to the failure of his company ABCL. Therefore, Bachchan started to support Amar Singh's political party, theSamajwadi Party. Jaya Bachchan joined the Samajwadi party and became aRajya Sabhamember."Bachchan has no plans for election."The Hindu.Bachchan has continued to do favours for the Samajwadi party, including advertisements and political campaigns. These activities have recently gotten him into trouble in the Indian courts for false claims after a previous incident of submission of legal papers by him, stating that he is a farmer.cite newshttp://www.webcitation.org/5bPT62ngoBollywood's Bachchan in trouble over crime claimAgence France-Presse4 October 2007

A 15-year press ban against Bachchan was imposed during his peak acting years byStardust (magazine)Stardustand some of the other film magazines. In his defence, Bachchan claimed to have banned the press from entering his sets until late 1989.cite webhttp://oldbh.bollywoodhungama.com/features/2007/01/27/2173/index.htmlThe 15-year ban on Bachchan!Oldbh.bollywoodhungama.com27 January 200724 March 2012
article.heading: Slump and retirement: 19881992
article.paragraph: In 1988, Bachchan returned to films, playing the title role inShahenshah (1988 film)Shahenshah, which was a box office success.cite webhttp://www.boxofficeindia.com/cpages.php?pageNameboxofficeindia.com/topactors.htmTop Actoryeshttps://web.archive.org/20131029191201/http://boxofficeindia.com/cpages.php?pageName29 October 2013After the success of his comeback film however, his star power began to wane as all of his subsequent films likeJaadugar,ToofanandMain Azaad Hoon(all released in 1989) failed at the box office. The 1991 hit film,Hum (film)Hum, for which he won his thirdFilmfare AwardsFilmfareFilmfare Award for Best ActorBest Actoraward, looked like it might reverse the trend, but this momentum was short-lived and his string of box office failures continued. Notably, despite the lack of hits, it was during this era that Bachchan won his firstNational Film Award for Best Actorfor his performance as a Mafia don in the 1990 filmAgneepath (1990 film)Agneepath.These years would see his last on-screen appearances for some time. After the release ofKhuda Gawahin 1992, Bachchan went into semi-retirement for five years. With the exception of the delayed release ofInsaniyat (1994 film)Insaniyat(1994), which was also a box office failure, Bachchan did not appear in any new releases for five years.cite webhttp://www.boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCatBox Office IndiaBox Office 1994yeshttps://web.archive.org/20130107074858/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCat7 January 2013
article.heading: Producer and acting comeback 199699
article.paragraph: Bachchan turned producer during his temporary retirement period, setting upAmitabh Bachchan Corporation, Ltd. (ABCL) in 1996, with a vision of becoming a 10 billion rupees (approx. U.S. $250 M) premier entertainment company by the year 2000.citation neededDecember 2012ABCL's strategy was to introduce products and services covering an entire cross-section of India's entertainment industry. ABCL's operations were mainstream commercial film production and distribution, audio cassettes and video discs, production and marketing of television software, and celebrity and event management.citation neededDecember 2012Soon after the company was launched in 1996, the first film it produced wasTere Mere Sapne (1996 film)Tere Mere Sapne,which did not fare well at the boxoffice but launched the careers of actors likeArshad Warsiand South films starSimran (actress)Simran.citation neededDecember 2012ABCL produced a few other films, none of which did well.citation neededDecember 2012

In 1997, Bachchan attempted to make his acting comeback with the filmMrityudata, produced by ABCL. ThoughMrityudaataattempted to reprise Bachchan's earlier success as an action hero, the film was a failure both financially and critically.citation neededDecember 2012ABCL was the main sponsor of theMiss World 19961996 Miss World beauty pageant,Bangalorebut lost millions. The fiasco and the consequent legal battles surrounding ABCL and various entities after the event, coupled with the fact that ABCL was reported to have overpaid most of its top level managers, eventually led to its financial and operational collapse in 1997. The company went into administration and was later declared a failed company by Indian Industries board.citation neededDecember 2012The Bombay high court, in April 1999, restrained Bachchan from selling off his Bombaybungalow'Prateeksha' and two flats till the pending loan recovery cases ofCanara Bankwere disposed of. Bachchan had, however, pleaded that he had mortgaged his bungalow to raise funds for his company.cite webhttp://www.tribuneindia.com/2001/20010304/spectrum/main1.htmMuqaddar Ka SikandarPatil, Vimla4 March 2001

Bachchan attempted to revive his acting career and had average success withBade Miyan Chote Miyan(1998),and received positive reviews forSooryavansham(1999)cite webhttp://in.rediff.com/movies/1999/may/22soo.htmTaliculam, SharmilaHe's back!but other films such asLal Baadshah(1999) andHindustan Ki Kasam (1999 film)Hindustan Ki Kasam(1999) were box office failures.
article.heading: Return to prominence: 2000present
article.paragraph: File:Amitabh Bachchan.jpgthumbBachchan at theIIFA Awardsin 2006File:Bachan mohanlal.jpgthumbrightBachchan withMohanlalIn 2000, Amitabh Bachchan appeared inYash Chopra's box-office hit,Mohabbatein, directed byAditya Chopra. He played a stern, older figure that rivalled the character ofShahrukh Khan. His role won him his thirdFilmfare Best Supporting Actor Award. Other hits followed, with Bachchan appearing as an older family patriarch inEk Rishtaa: The Bond of Love(2001),Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham...(2001) andBaghban (film)Baghban(2003). As an actor, he continued to perform in a range of characters, receiving critical praise for his performances inAks (film)Aks(2001),Aankhen (2002 film)Aankhen(2002),Khakee(2004) andDev (film)Dev(2004). One project that did particularly well for Bachchan wasSanjay Leela Bhansali'sBlack (2005 film)Black(2005). The film starred Bachchan as an ageing teacher of a deaf-blind girl and followed their relationship. His performance was unanimously praised by critics and audiences and won him his secondNational Film Award for Best Actorand fourthFilmfare Best Actor Award. Taking advantage of this resurgence, Amitabh began endorsing a variety of products and services, appearing in many television and billboard advertisements. In 2005 and 2006, he starred with his son Abhishek in the hit filmsBunty Aur Babli(2005), theThe GodfatherGodfathertributeSarkar (film)Sarkar(2005), andKabhi Alvida Naa Kehna(2006). All of them were successful at the box office.cite webBox Office IndiaAmitabh and Abhishek rule the box officehttp://www.boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCat11 March 2007http://www.webcitation.org/5ySa3xZ3S5 May 2011nocite webhttp://www.boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCatBox Office 2006Box Office India11 March 2007yeshttp://web.archive.org/web/20120217062452/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCat17 February 2012His later releases in 2006 and early 2007 wereBaabul (2006 film)Baabul(2006),cite webhttp://www.boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCatFilms fail at the BOBox Office Indiayeshttps://web.archive.org/20130818140640/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCat18 August 2013EkalavyaandNishabd(2007), which failed to do well at the box office but his performances in each of them were praised by critics.cite webBollywood HungmaAdarsh, Taranhttp://www.bollywoodhungama.com/trade/top5/326.htmlTop 5: 'Nishabd', 'N.P.D.' are disasters26 March 2007

In May 2007, two of his filmsCheeni Kumand the multi-starrerShootout at Lokhandwalawere released.Shootout at Lokhandwaladid well at the box office and was declared a semi-hit in India, whileCheeni Kumpicked up after a slow start and only had average success.cite webhttp://www.boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCatBox Office 2007Box Office Indiayeshttps://web.archive.org/20131109040918/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCat9 November 2013A remake of his biggest hit,Sholay(1975), entitledRam Gopal Varma Ki Aag, released in August of that same year and proved to be a major commercial failure in addition to its poor critical reception.The year also marked Bachchan's first appearance in an English-language film,Rituparno Ghosh'sThe Last Lear. The film premiered at the2007 Toronto International Film Festivalon 9 September 2007. He received positive reviews from critics who hailed his performance as his best ever sinceBlack.cite webhttp://oldbh.bollywoodhungama.com/features/2007/09/11/3020This is Amitabh's best performance after BlackBachchan was slated to play a supporting role in his first international film,Shantaram (film)Shantaram, directed byMira Nairand starring Hollywood actorJohnny Deppin the lead. The film was due to begin filming in February 2008 but due to the writer's strike, was pushed to September 2008.cite webourbollywood.comAmitabh Bachchan to star with Johnny Depphttp://www.ourbollywood.com/2007/02/amitabh_bachchan_will_star_opp.html11 March 2007http://web.archive.org/web/20070401195932/http://www.ourbollywood.com/2007/02/amitabh_bachchan_will_star_opp.html1 April 2007noThe film is currently "shelved" indefinitely.cite newshttp://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/books/features/the-diary-shantaram-film--lumiere-festival-tom-atkinson-hans-holbein-harold-evans-1819450.htmlUnderworld tale won't see light of day13 November 200923 May 2010LondonThe IndependentArifaAkbarVivek Sharma'sBhoothnath, in which he plays the title role as a ghost, was released on 9 May 2008.Sarkar Raj, the sequel of the 2005 filmSarkar (film)Sarkar, released in June 2008 and received a positive response at the box-office.Paa (film)Paa, which released at the end of 2009 was a highly anticipated project as it saw him playing his own son Abhishek's Progeria-affected 13-year-old son, and it opened to favourable reviews, particularly towards Bachchan's performance. It won him his thirdNational Film Award for Best Actorand fifthFilmfare Best Actor Award. In 2010, he debuted inMalayalam filmthroughKandahar (2010 film)Kandahar, directed byMajor Raviand co-starringMohanlal.cite webhttp://movies.rediff.com/interview/2010/jun/08/south-major-ravi-on-kandahar.htmMajor Ravi gets ready to shoot Kandahar: Rediff.com MoviesRediff.com8 June 20102 October 2010The film was based on the hijacking incident of theIndian Airlines Flight 814.cite webhttp://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/hindi/article/56171.htmlBig B in 'Kandahaar' along with Sunil Shettyindiaglitz.com14 April 2010Bachchan declined any remuneration for this film.cite webhttp://www.indianexpress.com/news/amitabh-to-forego-fee-for-sharing-screen-with-mohanlal/607690/0Amitabh to forego fee for sharing screen with Mohanlal[[The Indian Express]]17 April 2010In 2013 he made his Hollywood debut inThe Great Gatsby (2013 film)The Great Gatsbyplaying the role ofMeyer WolfsheimoppositeLeonardo DiCaprioandTobey Maguire.
article.heading: Television career
article.paragraph: File:Amitabh Bachchan KBC5 Press.jpgthumbright170pxAmitabh Bachchan at KBC-5 Press Meet.In 2000, Bachchan hosted the first season ofKaun Banega Crorepati(KBC), the Indian adaptation of the British television game show,Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?. The show was well received.cite newsSaxenaPoonamFive crore question: What makes KBC work?http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Television/Five-crore-question-What-makes-KBC-work/Article1-771297.aspxHindustan Times24 November 201119 November 2011A second season followed in 2005 but its run was cut short bySTAR Pluswhen Bachchan fell ill in 2006.cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/4648470.stmBBC NewsIndia scraps millionaire TV show25 January 20067 May 2010

In 2009, Bachchan hosted theBigg Boss (season 3)third seasonof the reality showBigg Boss.cite webAmitabh Bachchan back on TV with 'Bigg Boss 3'http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/Amitabh-Bachchan-back-on-TV-with-Bigg-Boss-3/articleshow/4973731.cmsTimes of IndiaSep 5, 2009

In 2010, Bachchan hosted the fourth season ofKBC.cite webhttp://entertainment.oneindia.in/television/top-stories/news/2010/kbc4-beats-bigg-boss4-131210.htmlKBC 4 beats Bigg Boss 4 in its final episodeOne India13 March 201113 December 2010The fifth season started on 15 August 2011 and ended on 17 November 2011. The show became a massive hit with audiences and broke many TRP Records. CNN IBN awarded Indian of the Year- Entertainment to Team KBC and Bachchan. The Show also grabbed all the major Awards for its category.citation neededJune 2013

The sixth season was also hosted by Bachchan, commencing on 7 September 2012, broadcast onSony TVand received the highest number of viewers thus far.cite webhttp://www.tellychakkar.com/news/kbc-season-6-opens-record-numbersKBC 6 & Amitabh's Charisma again breaks all records

In 2014, he debuted in the fictionalSony Entertainment TelevisionTV series titledYudh (TV series)Yudhplaying the lead role of a businessman battling both his personal and professional life.cite newshttp://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/television/watch-amitabh-bachchan-battles-world-himself-in-tv-show-yudh/Watch: Amitabh Bachchan battles world, himself in TV show ‘Yudh’2 May 2014The Indian Express
Bachchan is also the brand ambassador for Gujarat Tourism, which he has been since 1 February 2010.

article.paragraph: Amitabh Bachchan has invested in many upcoming business ventures. In 2013, he bought a 10% stake in Just Dial from which he made a gain of 4600 percent. article.paragraph: Apart fromNational Film Awards (India)National Film Awards,Filmfare Awardsand other competitive awards which Bachchan won for his performances throughout the years, he has been awarded several honours for his achievements in the Indian film industry. In 1991, he became the first artist to receive theFilmfare Lifetime Achievement Award, which was established in the name ofRaj Kapoor. Bachchan was crowned asFilmfare Special AwardSuperstar of the Millenniumin 2000 at the Filmfare Awards. TheGovernment of Indiaawarded him with thePadma Shriin 1984, thePadma Bhushanin 2001 and thePadma Vibhushanin 2015. France's highest civilian honour, the Knight of theLegion of Honour, was conferred upon him by theFrench Governmentin 2007 for his "exceptional career in the world of cinema and beyond".cite newsPandeyGeetahttp://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/6306201.stmSouth Asia | French honour for Bollywood starBBC News27 January 20072 October 2010In 2011, actorDilip Kumarblogged thatBlackshould have been nominated for an Oscar. Kumar added: "If any Indian actor, in my personal opinion, deserves the world's most coveted award, it is you."cite webhttp://www.indianexpress.com/news/big-b-overjoyed-to-receive-letter-from-dilip-kumar/888188/Big B overjoyed to receive letter from Dilip KumarThe Indian Express15 December 201110 January 2012

In 1999, Bachchan was voted the "greatest star of stage or screen" in aBBCYour Millenniumonline poll. The organisation noted that "Many people in the western world will not have heard of [him] ... [but it] is a reflection of the huge popularity of Indian films."cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/381017.stmENTERTAINMENT | Bollywood star tops the pollBBC News1 July 19992 October 2010http://web.archive.org/web/20100910010951/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/381017.stm10 September 2010noIn 2001, he was honoured with the Actor of the Century award at theAlexandria International Film Festivalin Egypt in recognition of his contribution to the world of cinema.cite webhttp://www.tribuneindia.com/2001/20010904/world.htm#8The Tribune, Chandigarh, India – WorldThe Tribune4 September 20012 October 2010http://wayback.archive.org/web/20131121110907/http://www.tribuneindia.com/2001/20010904/world.htm#810 December 2014Many other honours for his achievements were conferred upon him at several International Film Festivals, including the Lifetime Achievement Award at the 2010Asian Film Awards.cite webhttp://entertainment.oneindia.in/bollywood/news/2010/amitabh-asian-awards-250310.htmlActor Amitabh Bachchan | Film Paa – Oneindia EntertainmentEntertainment.oneindia.in25 March 20102 October 2010http://web.archive.org/web/20100920081630/http://entertainment.oneindia.in/bollywood/news/2010/amitabh-asian-awards-250310.html20 September 2010no
